physical.notes: Employee stole medical records from some area in the medical facility they work

social.notes: As noted above, the threat actions include physical contact with a co-defendant (FBI) to swap money for personal medical records to be used to steal identities

internal.notes: Video tells us she was a "doctor's office employee" no more specifics

partner.notes: Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)Agents of the secret service established a sting to obtain this information

asset.notes: At least 5 medical records were confirmed to be compromised (is 3rd party managed the correct indicator here? She does not "own" the information but manages is via employment of the medical center)

confidentiality.notes: No information shared on the implications of this data being released - since it was a sting I'm sure the data went unharmed

discovery_notes: The FBI was the co-defendant in this sting - requesting medical records by exchanging money with the distributor of the records

impact.notes: None were reported in the article;

notes: The co-defendant was an undercover FBI agent; The victim organization is an affiliate of Detroit Medical Center. However, the actual name of the organization was not released by the FBI at this time.
summary: A female employee of a medical center (name of affect org currently unreleased by the FBI) gave at least five (five have been confirmed) billing records to a co-defendant in May under the promise that she would be paid $100 per useable profile. The billing sheets contain the names, birth dates and Social Security numbers of patients, which could be used to steal identities.
